Start left hand on a pinch under the roof, and right hand on either a triangular ledge, or a slot/pinch type hold.  Big move left around the corner, then a fun, sequency top section.    There's also a potential low start using an undercling in the roof, and a crimp on the arete.

name: A Slab Called Spot
description: From the nice jug climb up the center of the spotted and fun slab.  Probably the best warmup in the area and a good climb in general.

name: Mixed Emotion
description: Classic?  You may doubt this, but yes.  It is.  Go try it.  Mike found and cleaned this beautiful line.  A sit start on crimps, an overhanging face with a discontinuous crack, and a scary topout.  What more could a Devil's Lake boulderer ask for?

name: Glory or Death
description: Climb up the center of the downhill facing side of the Glory or Death Boulder from a stand on nice side pulls.  Great moves above a very poor landing.  If you have enough pads it's doable..

name: Chilldo
description: Right hand on jug, left hand underneath the arete on a nice juggy hold, pull on and do a campus move, then trick your way up the cool pink boulder.  A very good problem.

name: Open Trenchcoat
description: Low start to Expose Yourself where you start squeezing both aretes underneath the nose in the roof.  Great moves, a scary landing though, with a drop off on one side and pointy rocks on the other.

name: Fat Trick
description: From a sit on the arête left of Mixed Emotions starting crossed on low incut flakes on the left side of the arête climb into the finish of Mixed Emotions.  Nice moves and have a good spotter to make sure you don't fly off the boulder if you ping off.

name: Snake Charmer
description: Start sitting kind of awkwardly on low good holds, do a hard pull to the nice flat big hold, and do some tricky and powerful moves up the blunt arete to good holds at the top.  Great moves

name: Fat Raccoon
description: Starting right hand in the jug and left hand underneath the roof climb up and left encountering some tough moves along the way.  A low start is possible and will bump the difficulty up.

name: Midwest Dream
description: From a sit or crouch on the right side of the roof, with your right hand in a good slot and left on a low undercling, pull on and climb leftwards across the lip of the roof finishing on the left side of the far arete.  The seam 2 feet above the lip was not used so instead of mantling out early you climb out the whole feature.     This is definitely one of my favorite of the grade (whatever it ends up being) I have done at the lake.

name: Fat Raccoon Sit aka Skinny Raccoon
description: Start on the low holds at the bottom of the roof and climb Fat Raccoon. The full line.

name: Miami Vice
description: From the obvious rail at the bottom of the roof and an edge just left of it, climb left into Vice Grip and finish as for that problem.  Likely the first V13 in Wisconsin and one of the hardest in the Midwest.

name: El Parasol Project
description: Climb out the huge, steep roof on sloping ledges and small crimps.  Unlike most roofs at the lake, this actually has a few holds on it.

name: Audacity
description: SDS under the overhang. Right hand on the lip and left hand on a perfect crimp in the crack. Get a high right heel hook (you've been going to yoga, right?) and you're off. Fun moves through a bulge over the lip and an unusually grippy top-out.    The crux is probably finding a spot for your tush, followed by the heel hook. After that, it's party time.

name: Insomnia
description: Awesome tall line up the tallest part of the face with the crux about 2/3 the way up, squeezing up a mini bulge. There is a committing throw to the lip. Really fun climbing.

name: Six Feet Under
description: Start on the rail in the pit, move up crimps to get to a bomber incut crimp (avoid the broken flake). Finish up towards the right. Height will certainly be an advantage.

name: Castle in the Sky
description: Start seated on a block down and right.  Make a big move into a good flake then trend left across the face.  Top out and and run up the high but easy slab.

name: Haunted Castle
description: Start same as Castle in the Sky, but from the jug on the left arete, instead of going straight up, continue traversing left over the slanted landing and top out on the far southwest corner of the boulder up a handcrack.

name: Peaches
description: Start low with left hand on a crimp rail and right hand on an undercling. Climb out the bulge and up the boulder.

name: Strawberry Peach Pie
description: Same start position as Strawberry Jam. Bump to the crimp out left then either move your right hand to a side pull or crimp before bumping up to the large sloper hold on Peaches and top out above.

name: Hobama Care
description: Start from a sit on the right side of the shield-like wall, with your left hand on a good sidepull, and right low on the arete.  Pull on, bust a move with your right, then pop out left and compress.  Squeeze up the shield, encountering a crimp, then an easing top out.  The crack out left was not used.  Climb the cool feature!

name: Bride of the Fox
description: Stand start on two slopey edges and climb directly up the technical slab. Execute the high crux and better holds await you above.

name: Happy-Go Highball
description: Climb up south facing corner of tall boulder.

name: Pale Blue Dot
description: Start on the jug rail and continue up through two more amazing rail features. Finish directly up the airy slab. An awesome climb, in my opinion. Much trickier than it looks.

name: Troubadour
description: Start matched on a jug under the roof, climb out the roof to the right and compress your way to a crack system on the headwall that leads to the topout.

name: Reign of Giants
description: Start in the middle of this large boulder on a set of jugs. Work your way up and left on delicate crimp moves. Top out at the point. There is a possible lower start to this, it might make it slightly harder.

name: Hidden Treasure
description: Start with slopey right hand ledge and nice left hand side pull. Work your way up the face. If you use the arete this climb will be easier.

name: The Subtle Knife
description: Stand start - left hand sidepull, right hand small crimp. Climb technical moves up the slightly overhanging face.

name: Master Gardener
description: Start in the pit with 2 blocky ledge hands right next to each other, and trick your way up the overhanging face.

name: Twist
description: Start under roof with left hand of slopey jug and right using a half pad mono pocket.  Hike feet and gun to pinch.  Set feet and throw for lip.  Top-out.  Super fun moves!

name: Apocalypto
description: Start with the jug as for Twist.  I started matched but it doesn't much matter.  Bust right to to a sloper then use edges and slopers to gain a jug then mantle onto the slab and finish it up.

name: Twisted
description: A low start to Twist.  Right on an edge in the roof, left on a chippy crimp (see photo).  A lower start might just happen and will likely make it even harder. It will likely be hard and good.  The crux move is a huge cross to an undercling and when you miss it you back flop hard.. 4/5 pads recommended.

name: Mystique
description: From a right undercling and left sidepull, bust a long move up the arête feature to a gaston.  Tricky moves lead to an easing finish.

name: Rogue
description: Start with a three finger edge for the right hand and a very obvious pinch/ slopey crimp next to it.  Bust left to another pinch and continue leftwards, gaining a jug and a crimpy bulge/slab encounter.

name: Rogue Direct Project
description: From the start of Rogue (a three finger edge for the right, and a pinch just next to it for the left) climb the center of the over hanging face, likely pinching arete features.  This will be good and quite hard.

name: Vine Street
description: Climb friction slab.  Similar to Super Slab just smaller, and trickier than it looks.

name: I Wanna Be Your Lover
description: Sit start with left hand crimp and right hand side pull.  Move up good edges and hit arete.  Top-out

name: Sunset Arete
description: Start low on jug and climb right leaning arete to apex.  On the same boulder as Darkest Before Dawn.  50 feet south of Gom Jabar at about the same level on the hillside though barely lower.

name: The Canine
description: This thin and slabby climb follows the face up the canine shaped boulder. From a stand or a sit work your way to a good ledge. Balance, mantle, crimp, or will yourself up to a high hold and topout.   Left blocky holds and right arete are both off  The positive crimps and low angle make this a satisfying puzzle to solve. Must do for this area!

name: The Howling
description: From a jug, climb the pillar on good holds for the most part.  There is a long reach at the top.  Take care, a fall near the top could be very bad.

name: Wolf Arete
description: From a sit on the left side of the arete, climb it.

name: Pack Mentality
description: From good holds right of the arete, climb to a jug, then commit to an airy sequence that uses the arete, high off the ground, to easing, but delicate and serious climbing up high.  A proud and incredible line.

name: Lone Wolf
description: Start sitting on a ledge, with an inverted diamond pinch for the left hand and punchy edge for the right. Move left, pull through a couple cruxy moves, then wrap left around the arete and up.  The top is pretty easy but a fall might be weird with a boulder behind you.

name: The Cellist
description: With dueling, three finger pocket side pulls, climb the striking little arete on cool holds to an engaging finish.  Super fun.

name: The Accordion
description: Start matched on a sharpish, incut edge on the left arete.  Move right one way or the other and compress up the feature. A sweet overhanging squeeze problem!

name: The Dulcimer
description: A drop off problem but really freaking cool.. Start on a ledge left of the very obvious, super clean arete with a large sidepull jug.  Gain the arete with huge feet, and with difficulty transfer around it and get the jug break.  Traverse off or drop from there.

name: Gom Jabbar
description: Start sitting left hand under roof on large sidepull and right hand on a good ledge on the right face. Pull on and and grab some awesome pinches near the arete, continue left along the lip and top out the same as Bene Gesserit.

name: Missionaria Protectiva
description: Sit start to Gom Jabbar. Start sitting left hand on a sidepull in the center of the roof and right hand on the arete. Pull hard into a compression knee bar (knee pad might be necessary) on right and toe hook at the base of the roof. Climb right into the start of Gom Jabbar and top out the same as Bene Gesserit.

name: A Quiet Place
description: Climb the right side of the arete from a stand.  Take care not to miss the pedestal if you fall.  I down climbed just right of the line back to the pedestal, which is much easier than the climb but very airy, which is why I gave it the x rating.

name: Blarney
description: Climb the arete from a stand, with a sidepull for the left hand to start.  A little tricky and pretty darn fun.  This boulder is a good warm up option for the area.

name: Massive Attack
description: A very long problem and pretty fun.  Start in corridor on jugs.  Climb up and right above jumbled boulders, crossing a crack system then continue right and up the face.

name: B.I.A.
description: Start on the jug.  Climb the arete and face feature.  A fun and awesome problem that stays on you until the end.

name: Edge of the Earth
description: Start on the large jug feature near the center of the face and work straight up using small crimps and sidepulls. About halfway up, I trended to the right arete and finished up around the corner (without using the detached blocks). Staying true to the center is a project waiting to be done.

name: Flat Earth Project
description: From the incut rail, climb the center of the slab.

name: Beautifully Ordinary
description: Started right hand in the crack and left on the smiley hold on the left face.  Follow the crack on large holds to an easy topout.  Great warmup on comfy holds.

name: Zoo Full Of Defective Animals
description: Start on a flat edge down and left of the large boulder that makes up the landing.  Climb up and right through the prominent arete with long pulls between large breaks.

name: The Fire Down Under
description: Start low on underclings and move up to edges along arete.  Make a big move to a jug and top-out.

name: Hurricane
description: Start compressing arete with right hand on nice side-pull and left on corner.  Go straight up!

name: Into the Fire
description: This is a detached block roof feature that looks intimidating but climbs great. You'll encounter a juggy arete for one hand, great underclings for the other, and a sloping platform for feet to keep the tension. Stick in a kneebar or heel hook, reach the hold on the face, finish the easy top out, and smile! There are still good problems to be found at the lake :-)

name: A Little Sauce
description: Start sitting on the angled boulder, facing the corner with hands matched low in the crack. Step onto decent feet and make a big move to good holds on the horizontal. Switch your stance and use the arete to top out.   This is a detached block and although solid, one day it will fall. Pulling on it during the topout creates an uneasiness that either adds or takes away from the climb, depending on your outlook that day

name: Out of the Frying Pan
description: This is an extension of the roof climb, Into the Fire. Left of the roof, start low on the small arete with hands on the shelf and a heel around the arete. Move up to a stand on decent crimps then traverse right and climb Into the Fire. This line extends the pump factor while adding  movement and a more defined start to an already fun climb.

name: Dyno
description: Start low on jugs, and gain slopey hold for the left hand.  From there hike feet and dyno for the lip.  Super fun!   See pictures on previous page.

name: Pack Your Sewing Machine
description: Start on a good blocky hold down low and work your way into the finger crack.

name: Obsidian Nightmare
description: Start on a great jug for your left and a positive sidepull for your right.  After a couple of easier intro moves, navigate through a tricky section to reach positive holds on the right side of the arete.

name: All Power, No House
description: Sit start on obvious sidepulls and do a really fun bounce move to a positive edge up high.  Follow techy feet to an easy topout.

name: Dreamo
description: Start with your right hand on the brick pinch on the arete, left on the good side pull.  Climb engaging moves up phenomenal holds to a fun and exciting finish move.

name: Bone Saw
description: Physical and full body feature climbing.. Start left hand gaston pinch, and right lower, opening the elevator door on a fin.  Gain the arete and continue up.  A slopey crimp in the face and a knee scum or two could be helpful.

name: Heaven's Gate
description: One of the best in Wisconsin; A five star boulder anywhere. Heaven's Gate is a long power endurance boulder that follows a natural traverse line climbing most of the boulder(Should be noted that there's possibility for a direct top out variation although it may be more contrived, harder, and definitely more dangerous than this line). There is no super defined crux, but the move to the last good hold before you top out has some difficulty and a fall from this position would be quite dangerous. Starts on a large rail low and to the right.

name: Archangel
description: A real gem, likely one of the best for the grade around.  From a stand climb the shield like face and double arete feature. The top is a bit committing but it does pad up well.

name: Eternal Punishment
description: One of the best at the lake; classic anywhere. Sit starts on an obvious juggy rail. Crux is the first two moves, where you likely are going to do a big move to a crimp and then jump to a jug. From here the difficulty eases up but the landing isn't great and its not easy to pad. Originally done topping out straight up above the start but the far more natural line is traversing right as soon as you can at the top(topping out direct doesn't change difficulty but topping out this way makes it an X).

name: Super Slab
description: Find a good way up the middle of slab using edges and side-pulls.  This thing is super fun, the face is huge and loaded with options.

name: Moj
description: This thing is rad!  Start low on left, establish left hand pinch and stab out right to good edge.  Keep you core tight and get feet set to bump your left hand to the finish.

name: More Cowbell
description: A good line but intimidating! Start sitting on the ledge.  Right sidepull, left pinch.  Punch up left to an incut, somehow gain a ledge system out left, then trend more left to a cruxy finish. The end is actually quite safe.

name: Purple Dragon
description: Start right hand on a sloper on the lip with a chip out of it and left hand on a nice side pull in the overhanging face and climb the boulder.  Cool slopers and some good tenuous moves.  This is a stand to the Corner Project.

name: Purple dragon low
description: Start left hand on sidepull and right hand on the arete.  Find some bad feet and go to the lip!    Later edit: see video

name: The Last Unicorn
description: Start from a crouch with your right hand on a bump on the arete, and left on a sidepull (the higher friendly one).  Do a hard first move to the lip then trend right and finish as for Moj.  IMO one of the best and fun real hard boulders in the state.  This was envisioned by Steve Schultz and friends when Moj was first put up and took some effort to get done.

name: Another Coin in the Wishing Whale
description: Start matched on an obvious edge/pinch on the right side of the face.  Bust big left to the prominent jug and top out.  Starting from the jug is a V0/1 Walk the Plank.  A lower start from edges goes at V5.

name: Lochness Monster
description: With a good hold for the right and an edge for the left, set a heal and smack a sloper.  Continue onwards.

name: Live With Porpoise
description: Start with a sloper sidepull for the left, and a downpulling crispy hold for the right on the face.  Squeeze up the arete!

name: Storm Troopers
description: Starting on a right hand undercling and your left hand on the block work your way out the roof on cool slopers to a finicky throw for the lip.

name: Storm Troopers Right
description: Do the first couple moves of Storm Troopers to the slopers, get your feet off the block some how and follow the slopers right to a jug and top out.

name: Basking Pine
description: Good warm up friendly.

name: Quaking Aspen
description: Nice warm up,

name: Safety Maple
description: Crux is first move with left hand, short but fun climb up the corner edge of a large boulder

name: A View to Kill
description: Start with two good under-clings and power your way to the lip.

name: To Crimp A Butterfly
description: Start in the crack and trend right working your way through a series of small holds.

name: Fatterpillar
description: Start in the crack and trend left up into the arete.

name: P.Stachio
description: Start on a good right hand crimp and a left hand pinch and move up the prominent pillar.  Squeeze your way up and throw for the good jug at the top.  Committing last move!

name: Magnum PI
description: Start on slanted foot chip and side pulls. Great moves up the center of this great boulder.

name: Reaching For Daylight
description: Start low on a left hand jug and a higher right crimper. Climb up the outer part of the overhang arete onto several well deserved jug rails above.

name: Fish & Gritz
description: Climbs the obvious crack in the corner. Start under the roof on two good finger locks. Sink some super fun jams through the low roof into some easier but more committing moves to the top.     The top is a bad place to fall, but you can bail onto the opposing slab pretty easily if things get sketchy...    Gave it 4 stars because the movement was so fun... Maybe deserves less because of the goofy landing situation...

name: Liger
description: Start sitting, matched on an edge.  Climb up the beautiful and tall arete.

name: The Uninviting
description: Crux is near the beginning. 2-3 pads is sufficient protection. Moves are good but dab factor decreases quality.

name: Chasing Daydreams
description: Start low and left on a jug with a big foot hold and with a right crimp. Pull the roof and throw to a jug.

name: Night Train
description: Start as for Monorail (with a jug on the arête) with Liger and Double Edge Sword at your back.  Climb the tall face and continue onwards to the summit via the airy and easy slab.  Really good, probably one of the best of the grade in the park!

name: Double Edge Sword
description: Start sitting with you left hand on a good down pulling ledge, and right on a low pinch on the face.  Squeeze up the tall pillar.  This is just left of Liger.

name: Le Freak
description: Start low on a large jug and climb directly up the face using larger sidepulls.

name: King Crab
description: Start sitting, with a left sidepull seam, and a right undercling.  Climb up the tall face.  The first few moves are the crux, the finish is fairly serious.  Named after an incredible pinch hold that's used.

name: Oval Office
description: Start crouched in the pit, with your right hand on a triangle pinch, and left on a low incut sidepull.  Climb up and left.  Move left around the arete on pretty good holds to top out high above a jumbled landing.

name: Iron Jesus
description: Start sitting in the corner of the room.  Climb up and leftward, encountering a shoulder intensive crux sequence.  Move left above the beginning of Oval office, wrap around the arete, and follow the airy top out of Oval office.  Really fun and 20 plus moves.

name: Warm-up
description: Start in middle of boulder on good jugs, and climb up steep face on large holds.

name: Flower Power
description: Start on left of two crimps with right hand and left hand on slope side pull. Climb out left of roof and top out.

name: Power Bottom
description: Start on two good head height edges under the roof.  Do a couple of powerful moves to reach the lip and top out.  This is a lower start to the problem "Take a Stand".

name: Fully Charged
description: Start with slanting jug right of Real Power.  Climb the tall arête with the hardest moves being low, though the top is thin and you are definitely still climbing.  The landing is not good for a fall up high, be careful! You can pull on from a neighboring boulder and work any of the moves.

name: Real Power
description: This is the low start to "Power Hour" and the real line on the right side of the boulder.  Start low on a left hand undercling and a right hand crimp / pinch and make a big move (Nic), use some toe hook wizardry (Peter), or something else (???) to gain the rail on "Power Hour."  Top out on that problem.

name: Bottoms Up
description: A low start to Power Bottom starting with the two obvious far edges in the same seam as the OG start holds of Power Bottom.  Probably establish on the wall by facing out and getting a toe hook on the lip.

name: Blade Runner
description: From a sit, matched on a sloper, climb the overhanging blade feature. Other walls and boulders are not used.

name: Down and Dirty
description: Awesome 15 foot roof offwith in a cave.    Start by laying on your back and throwing your feet into the crack at the lowest point in the roof, about 15 feet into the cave. Climb the wide crack going through a couple of rocks that are stuck in the crack (they are on). When you reach the end of the crack, climb the cruxy roof to gain the jugs at the point. Continue on good holds to the top.    You may need to take a couple of minutes to clean out roots and debris that like to gather in the crack.

name: Jenga
description: Start down left on obvious jug, and work your way out right to corner and up to top.  The Double heel hook works great to hold yourself on.   Brian originally rated this V7, however, it does feel a bit easier.

name: Hungry Hungry Hippos
description: Start on Jenga and move into the stand start of Hungry Hippos.  It turned out to be a surprisingly natural line with really cool movement.

name: Tonsillitis
description: This boulder problem starts with your left hand in a crack on the left side of the arete and your right hand on the obvious jug on the right side of the arete. from there make your way up the boulder on balancy moves and top out at the peak of the arete. fun and beautifully located.

name: Empty Space
description: Start on a good left hand sidepull and a crimp for the right and climb some fun, engaging moves up a cool face.

name: Loompa Land
description: Start matched on a good low sidepull and do some tensiony moves up a series of sidepulls.

name: World War Z
description: Worth seeking out, start sitting with obvious big ledge for your hands.  Trend left through the overhanging face via prominent ledges and mantle with a juggy undercling probably helping a lot.

name: Beautiful and the Bold(Project)
description: Proud!  This boulder is big and beautiful.  Could have a couple options:  First, climb the left side following the corner, the other would stay to the right(terrible landing and much harder).

name: Trust Fund Slab
description: Very cool low angled slab with really neat rock.

name: Recreational Vehicle
description: On the far right side of the area is a nice right to left traverse on slopers.  Cool moves and a late crux make this one worthy.

name: Hogleg Overhang
description: Head up the tall overhanging face and arete, top out straight up over slopey lip.  Classic highball.

name: Anchorpoint
description: Start left hand on big sidepull jug and right hand on big flat jug.  Use a heel hook and some trickery to gain a crimp and top out on slopers.  Classic!!

name: Double Elephant
description: Starting under the middle of prow, climb up and left gets you into big moves squeezing the bulge.  Huge huck to the thank-god jug for the top-out.  Committing, and bring the spotters.

name: Tranquility Pillar
description: Start sitting with a jug.  Move right onto the striking face.  Climb the face, bumping up the arete with your left hand.  The wall left of the wide crack doesn’t come into play.   Beware, there are some moves up high, so be prepared.  If this were on a freestanding boulder in a meadow it would be world class, no doubt. Instead it is here, really close to the car, and still awesome! Comparable to the nearby Godzilla in terms of difficulty and quality, and more accessible, though probably a little more serious.

name: The Pecan Tree
description: Start low and right in a good horizontal. Make a few powerful moves on bad feet into some bigger moves up the face. Top section is easy but heads-up. Gave it 4 stars for really the fun movement. Maybe it deserves less...

name: Godzilla
description: Start sitting on the obvious jug.  Climb up and left to the arête, and continue through an airy finish. The other walls/detached blocks are off.

name: Mothra
description: A proud line.  Start sitting with the obvious jug, same as for Godzilla.  Instead of heading left to the arete, climb straight up the tall, aesthetic face through sidepulls, seam holds, and edges.  There is a committing move up high.

name: Karloff
description: Sit start on good edge to the right of large block sitting under the boulder.  Climb up right arete on funky pinches and ledges to the jug right below the top out.  reach back and crank the feet high and roll it out.

name: Youggary
description: Start on large side pull.  Move thought a large ledge onto moderate crimps. Exit boulder on right side or the large crack that splits the boulder.

name: Kajiu
description: Sit start same as Karloff.  Move thorough the horizontal rail to the left.  Exit to an airy finish to the left of the vertical crack that splits the boulder.

name: Slabby McGee
description: Have you ever touched slab before? The smooth, almost glassy, or otherwise lichen covered slick? NO?! Then this is for you. Put the kids on it, even.

name: Darkside
description: Starting in the back of the cave on the slightly overhanging wall with your left hand on a good hold on the arete and your right on an obvious slopey hold, pull on and trend rightward encountering fun and sometimes tricky moves. Once you reach the other arete you can drop off on juggy holds in a seam. This is always shady and has a very good landing.

name: Relic
description: Start on a jug above a slippery slab.  Trend left through the corridor, fun moves and cool holds along the way.  Top out near the left arete.  Reminiscent of the classic Autobot in RMNP and about as hard.  Falls likely won’t be too bad, I only give it PG13 because of the less than perfect landing.  A couple pads and a slider is pretty good.  As long as you don’t blow the opening move (the easiest on the climb) you should be alright.  This is definitely worth seeking out if you’re looking for fun climbs of the grade, it’s sustained and has quite a few moves.  If you’re looking for v4/5 with fantastic views, linking this with the pretty close 45 degree boulder would be a great day out.

name: Aramandi
description: Start sitting, with a crimp/pinch for the right hand and a crimpy sidepull for the left.  Climb the arete.  Quite tiring and a little trickier than it looks.

name: Ace of Spades
description: Start sitting in the middle of the pretty face.  Left hand on a sidepull, right on an edge below.  Gain the right arete and climb the sweet feature.  This thing is pretty darn awesome! The stand start is a fun V3/4ish problem.

name: John Dillinger
description: Start sitting with two large underclings, slot the left kneebar and climb up face using sloping sidepulls and nice two finger pocket, topout left rolling up onto the horn.

name: Public Enemy
description: A cool roof 100 feet off of the trail just above the last cabin before the trail starts on the south side of the West Bluff.

name: Hammer Club Sit
description: Sit down and right and climb into Hammer Club

name: Alpine Club
description: Start on the obvious jug and start to wonder why this wasn't as easy as you thought it was going to be.  A deceivingly difficult problem to say the least.

name: Fight Club
description: Sit start down and right from alpine club and climb into it.  FA started matched on good holds to the right.

name: Oofda Arête
description: Start sitting with a jug, under the min roof. Squeeze up the arête to a somewhat airy though easing finish. Surrounding blocks/ walls etc. are not used.

name: The Milf
description: Sit start on blocky jug on left arete and move up via rightward trending rail into the final jugs on the right side of the boulder.

name: Beautiful Soup
description: Start on the left hand sidepull crimp and go up right to another small crimp.  Big huck for the rail and then traverse off right to the jug on right side of wall.

name: Pi Maker
description: Slap up the arete left of Beautiful Soup and topout via the Key Maker.  The arete felt about v7 to the jug break.  Good climbing. Unnamed and unrated, so the grade is just a guess..

name: Soupmaker
description: Climb the crux of Beautiful Soup but instead of heading right at the ledge go straight up the finish of Keymaker.  A pure line with no traversing.

name: The Key Maker
description: Start at the bottom right corner of the Beautiful Soup boulder on an undercling and edge.  Work your way up and left until you get into the start holds of Beautiful Soup.  Do the moves on BS to reach the rail but instead of traversing off right continue straight up to the top of the boulder using a very small, slopey crimper.

name: The Compressor
description: Compress up the overhanging refrigerator block.  See Photo for start.  A little dabby but great moves and some cool slopers.

name: Misery Pillar Crack
description: Start low in overhang and bust up to slopers.  Mantle into the crack and follow that up to top.  Heads up top-out!

name: Wednesday Nighter
description: Climb obvious crack to top.

name: Lost in Eden (Crimp Overhang)
description: Climb up pyramid shaped face on thin holds to a big dyno to jug.

name: Bulbous Left Center
description: A Classic hardman problem!  Start on good hold at base of overhang and make big moves to good pinches.  Technique and power get you up this one.  Top out right along the lip.

name: Silently Judging
description: Starts with left hand on sidepull jug and right on vertical crimp.  Make a move left to a fat edge and windmill your way up to the roof.  After the roof keep your cool and bare down on the good crimps until your standing on the top.

name: Atlas Lion
description: Start sitting matched in an obvious vertical slot.  A powerful first pull followed by an incredible thin pinch, then a jug and an attention keeping finish.

name: The Cardinal
description: Start sitting, squeezing low, wide sidepulls.  Maybe grab a jug up left first then trend up and right gaining an incredible slopey pinch in the middle of the face.  Shouldery and barn doory moves right to the arete then an easing finish.  The detached ledge/block feature right of the wall is not used.

name: Silently Judging Sit
description: The low start to Silently Judging.  Right hand starts on a softball sized hold and left on a vertical crimp.  Heal hook your way though some "comp style" climbing through the the start of the stand.

name: Best Bulge aka Black Rhino
description: A true stunner! From the obvious jug climb straight up the tall overhanging wall.  Sustained and committing, though it does get easier at the top.

name: Don't Want Your F!@ $%g Trail Mix
description: Start on two pinches down low with tight foot,  throw for jug. use side pull and jugs out ride to top out

name: Lou Reed Lunge
description: Climb LR Crack and at 8ft mark dyno to hold out right.

name: Balanced Rock
description: Pull onto block and gun for the summit.

name: Solidarity
description: This is a good one if you are into steep, powerful stuff... and it’s not so far from the car.  A nice find by Baker. Start crouched with sidepulls.  A big opening move to a sloper with little edges on it likely leads to some moves left, a tricky foot cut or switch, and then a mantle that you might not want to fall off.

name: No Place for a Horse
description: Start on low jug and climb to point. At first we did it with a right toe hook and that might have been a 4 but then we found a heel out left and that made it more like V2. Still super fun moves

name: Bunker Arete
description: super good moves up the Arete and a fun top out. with some work most holes could be filled but with enough pads all things look better.

name: Muffin Top
description: Start on the right side of the obvious crack that runs through the width of the boulder and traverse left around the side of the boulder.

name: Riptide
description: Climb the rippled slab that faces directly downhill.  Start with hands on opposing aretes, hike feet over the lip and balance your way up to the lip.  A fun and committing problem!

name: Ripples of Time
description: This is the low start to Dolphin Fingers and the whole line in my opinion.  Start with your right hand on the arete, and your left on a toothy and small 3 finger hold just above the lip.  Climb leftwards along the lip.  This is a physical compression problem and the moves are super fun.

name: Feature Presentation
description: A low start to Ice Queen. Start with left hand on a three finger tooth and right at the low part of the arete.  Climb into Ice Queen.

name: Horn of Africa
description: Start high, matched in the obvious slot or perhaps do a couple campus moves into it.  Move right, somehow gaining the big horn feature and finish it up.

name: The Fukness
description: Starting with a jug a chest level on the left arete, climb rightwards through the face on seams and crimps to a not so bad top out.  Get on this thing, it's a fun hard problem.

name: Rarity Roof
description: A pretty wild one! Start with your left hand in a blocky gaston and right on a faint slipper next to it.  With some awkwardness set an extended, and aggressive toehook out right to establish on the problem.  Probably ride the toehook and shuffle out the right side of the roof to a somewhat easing finish.

name: Big Foot Arete
description: From a sit on the obvious big ledge, climb up the arete.

name: Heatwave
description: Start crouched, right hand with an obvious full hand sidepull and left with a low sidepull. Squeeze up the arete top out. Pretty darn fun, the start is the crux.

name: Space Pants
description: Sit start under small roof with right hand on good edge and left hand on dimple feature and climb up the prow.

name: Barnyard
description: Start with your hands matched on the right side arete and follow it up using a right sloper to get onto the easy side. Really aesthetic arete climb that is on a ridge overlooking the lake. Definitely has been climbed before, but haven't been able to find it in anywhere on MP or a book. If you continue left instead of using the sloper it was definitely harder

name: On The Eve
description: Start on positive opposing sidepulls and go directly up the clean face on positive, comfy holds.  Nice warmup for the area.

name: Never Tell Me the Odds
description: From a sit with a right facing jug, climb the dihedral feature. A nice little problem, probably of similar quality and a similar feature to There is No White Knight if you are familiar with that one though a bit more on the feet and a bit harder.

name: Card Shark
description: Sit start on rail and make some difficult moves up overhang. Maybe bring a kneebar pad.

name: Barking Spiders
description: SDS low and right.  Move left through protruding feature on face and throw to the lip.

name: Trash Panda
description: Start low and right with a LH undercling and RH on arete. Make a strong move to a thin sharp crimp on the slab and slap out left. Continue up and left to top out.

name: Wildwood
description: Gorgeous line starting on right side of face.  SDS with right hand on good ledge, left hand on decent sloper and feet out right.  Move out left to rail and use some fancy footwork to head up from there using decent holds and left arete.

name: The Bee's Knees
description: Start in Horizontal crack under rippled roof and work your way up good holds to the top out.

name: The Wizard
description: Difficult continuous compression problem on arete. Sit Start with left hand a descent side pull and right hand on arete.  Stand up on sloping feet and bump right hand to crimp.  A series of bumps and pinches to the top.

name: Don't F With the Bees
description: Start sitting on jug flake down and right.  Climb up using compression encountering a tough move to a sloper near the end.   A good problem.  This was the Harpoon Project.

name: Awning Crack
description: Climb large crack.

name: Not Your Grandmothers Boulder Problem
description: This is the scary left trending exit on the "Office Project" Boulder.     Sit start on good side pull make one move over the pedestal landing then trend left through an under-cling into definite no fall territory.   You will have good side pulls and one really high step to a committing move to a good sloper. Then jugs at the lip.    Keep breathing and stay calm this climb is not for the faint of heart.

name: Levitation (formerly The Office Project)
description: This boulder sticks out like a sore thumb in the talus field to the north of the lost and found area, it's simply huge!  On the downhill face of this boulder is a difficult thin climb.  All the holds are there, it was just over my head.  Landing is a flat elevated pedestal.  A little heady to spot, but should be fairly safe. A proud line there for the taking.

name: Cake Knife
description: From a crouch, with a good full pad sidepull for the right and left on a good slopey spot near the base of the arete, climb the technical and tricky arete. Gain better holds up high, mantle, and the easiest way off is to down climb left.  We both thought this was quite fun.

name: Six Foot Girlfriend
description: Sit start and match hands on the crimp. Work the left and right point crimps up the face and out the roof. Match on the second ledge for finish.

name: Left Crack
description: From the left side climb up into jam crack.

name: Thin Crack
description: Crank the face moves up into good jug, from there climb nice splitter crack to top.

name: Tombstone Classic
description: Same start as Tombstone Direct, then up-and-right (but still perhaps more direct than the direct?). The route stays just left of crack in the upper wall.    A classic in its own right, this is Gill's original line on the wall.

name: Headstone
description: Just around the corner from Thin Crack, start in middle of wall and climb up thin holds to top out.

name: Tombstone Direct
description: Start on crescent holds in the middle of face.  Head up and left for a tricky finish.

name: Snuggle Bunny
description: On the West side of the boulder.  From a sit, left hand on blade hold and right on a seam crimp climb the short rippled face into good holds to the top.  There are some aggressive holds on this one.

name: True Lies
description: Start as for the False, matched on the obvious blocky hold.  Climb up the face, gaining the right arete and topping out at the apex of the Boulder.  An intricate, proud, and striking line.

name: The False
description: From a stand, matched on a left facing block hold, pull on with difficulty and climb up through slopey pinch holds to a juggy hold.  From there move left to top out.

name: Ice Man
description: From a sit with your left hand in a crack, right on a sidepull, climb the striking arete.  Be wary of loose rock up high.

name: Bearded Lady
description: Same start of The Petrified Man. Move directly up to a good crimp high above the roof. Hike your feet and hit a good jug. Move up arete to top out.

name: Widow Maker
description: Start same as the rest of the problems on the boulder. Move straight up the middle of the boulder on small crimps.

name: Anarchist Crack
description: Route 57 in Sven's book. Short but very enjoyable crack climb. Better off bouldering this route.

name: Crack
description: Climb up thin seam and move left up high to easier finish.

name: Saddle Sores
description: Another one with interesting beta.  SDS with hands on both sides of the roof and your back facing the wall.  Pull your legs up and over until you have mounted the horse.   Does anyone have a copy of the Rock and Ice issue that featured pictures of Eric sending this thing?  If so please scan them in.

name: The Flatiron
description: The first rock an out of breath climber encounters upon reaching the East Rampart is the Flatiron, a perfect little boulder reminiscent of its much larger counterparts in Colorado.  Two parallel cracks spill down from the top, and the difficulty of the problem lies in attaining these cracks. Easier variations exist on both sides. One hard variation uses only the right crack.  Climb this problem on a busy summer weekend, and be prepared to feel like an animal in a zoo.    I hesitate to list this as a "chipped route" despite the rumors that Gill deliberately broke a loose flake out of the upper pocket in the right crack.  Gill was bad ass, and it seems unclear why he would chip an already large hold on the easier upper part of the problem.  Does anyone know if the rumor is true?

name: Martini Madness
description: Start on left arete and face holds eventually getting up and right into upper face.

name: Big Flat Iron
description: Start from a sit, matched on the polished foot most use for their feet for the classic Flat Iron.  Crimp down and bust a tricky move left to a good side pull and continue up the Flat Iron. This will probably get some heat but four of us did this and we all thought it was pretty fun.  So there ya go.

name: The Nihilist
description: Sweet slab climbing up a beautiful quartz face.  Stand start in the thin seam left of Anarchist Crack, and go straight up.  Arete to the left, and Anarchist Crack to the right are off, but don't really come into play.

name: The Zipper
description: This is an impressive effort by Eric Zschiesche. The blank looking face to left of Monster was an aid climb. Now, a balls out high ball boulder problem. It's not "git on it" but "GIT UP IT!!!!"

name: Unzipped(aka The Zipper Direct)
description: Same start as the Zipper, but from the finger jug you stay direct on the wall.   Classic moves with a scary and hard finish!  Harder than the original.

name: The Captain's Traverse
description: Start at the base of the left corner and traverse right with reachy moves between good holds.

name: Rail Gun
description: Start on Undercling sidepulls and finesse your way out the little roof and then move up and right to top out

name: Fat Pants
description: Start matched on the low jug on the left side and compress up the arete.  Fun climbing

name: The Ivory Face
description: Climb the center of the beautiful, blank looking, white wall from a sit in the obvious horizontal.

name: Decadence
description: Excellent line up the CCC Trail Project boulder! Begin under the roof with a left hand slot crimp and a right hand block. Establish and climb out of the roof onto the textured vertical face avoiding the detached block under the roof. Great movement up a proud boulder!

name: Heads Up Arete
description: Sweet boulder 15ft off of CCC trail. Start at right side overhand with small crimp on corner and follow the rail/arete to the exciting top out. Sit start and face direct are significantly harder.

name: Still Awake
description: Sharing the right arete with the V1 Still Sleeping, this compression problem was uncovered after a tree blocking the left arete was mysteriously removed.  Differing in character from other climbs on the sleepytime boulder, this problem relies more on power than technical footwork. From a stand, find small feet, squeeze both aretes, and power your way up to the boulder's apex. The good holds, slight overhang, and clean landing make this thing great!

name: Fully Aroused
description: Start on good in-cut edge.  Crank you way up left to dime-edge crimp.  Get your feet set and hit the top.  Technical and fun.

name: Slab of Doom
description: Start low and right on big ledge.  Move out left to good edges and work feet to gain high in-cut crimp.  Top-out.

name: Flux Boulder Classic
description: The left Obvious Line on the Flux Boulder.  Start standing on the big right facing sidepull feature and climb up the technical face with cool holds to a slightly insecure topout.  In the shade most the day since a large pine tree is over the boulder.

name: Purple Shadow
description: A traverse on the Flux Boulder.  Sticky Arête into the far left line Dry Fired.

name: Diesel Additive
description: Start with the same sidepull for the right hand as for Influx and a slopey undercling just left and down in the roof for the left.  A burly first move leads to more climbing out the roof and up the arete.  A lower start to Influx.

name: The Pedestal
description: Climb the the Hanging double arete Boulder.

name: The Piano
description: From a sit on the uphill side of the boulder with your left hand on a good edge on the lip and your right on the low jug, pull on and follow interesting slopey holds that you will have to grab just right all the way around the corner and top out.  Really fun and pumpy!  Do be careful though, if you explode off there is a very good chance you could go tumbling down the hill...

name: Inkwell
description: Start on obvious rail, possibly with a gaston spot for the left hand.  Gain an undercling in the face and pull through to better holds above.  An elegant little problem.

name: Green Sharpie
description: From the start of Purple Sharpie (sit, left hand on edge by left arete, right hand in the face on an incut side pull), move left, rock onto the slab, and finish up the slab via the face and arete.  Surprisingly fun, we thought.

name: Purple Sharpie
description: Start sitting with right hand in small incut edge on face, left hand crimp on arete. A few fun compression moves will get you to the top.

name: Purple Hatchet
description: With a sidepull for the left hand and a slick pinch crimp for the right, establish with difficulty.  A couple tense and hard moves will get you to the mantle.  A blubber pad would be nice for this one.

name: Purple Hatchet Project
description: From a sit climb the aesthetic arete.  There are holds and maybe there is a way.

name: Gills Booger
description: Stand start with large pinch feature.  Hike feet and dead-point to lip.  Top out along lip to the right.

name: Fist Fight
description: You'll find this monster directly below Brinton's Buttress. Move down through the talus until you come upon a large overhanging boulder with a huge roof fist crack. The Good - it's a giant roof crack. The Bad - it's painful as hell. Tape is highly recommended.

name: Cory's Problem
description: On the rampart roof boulder.  On the left of the downhill facing side and do a tricky sequence to a good hold and trend left on jugs above a boulder and mantel it out.

name: Rampart Roof
description: Start low in middle of boulder and work your way up and out roof to good holds at the lip.  Two variations exist.     Wow, this boulder is impressive!  It sits about 50ft down the talus from Many Pines Buttress and sticks out like a sore thumb.  It's huge and has a beautiful roof with lots of features.

name: Purple Heart
description: Start in the Center of the downhill facing overhanging face and go right around the arete and topout on the slab.  The safety line on the boulder.

name: Brave Heart
description: Climb directly up the left arete of the downhill side of the Rampart Roof Boulder.  This is a cool and exposed feeling climb with the hard moves at the top.

name: Brinton’s Arete Left V3/V6 sit
description: For the sit, start on the left side of the arete, with a low downpulling crimp for the left hand and a gaston for the right.  Climb the left side of the arete.  A sustained and pretty darn good problem with a quite a good landing.  For the stand, just stand.  It’s a sweet problem.  From a previous description by Peter Erard in 2007 : "The crux would be the second move from a standing start. What's bad about it? The hands, barely any handholds. When there are handholds, they're non-existent. Semi-sharp edges leading into a slopy two-finger edge. From there, finish on top with a solid bomber hold."

name: High Crimes and Misdemeanors
description: Start from a sit or crouch under the overhanging belly.  Right hand on a sloper edge above arete, left on a positive edge.  Squeeze out the bulge and send the boulder.  Quite good, spot the finish well.  A lower start is a project.

name: Funeral Service
description: Start low and left on good side-pulls.  Work your way up center of face using a combination of balance and power.  Finish move is exciting!

name: Zebra Slab
description: A very cool face. Climb straight up the middle using good edges and side pulls. Crux is halfway up.

name: The Postmaster
description: No text - use the 'Improve This Page' link to add something useful!

name: I See the Bucket
description: Climb tall face with a committing topout.  This face feels almost like sandstone with actual texture.  Originally a toprope and listed in the "West Post" crag in Swartling guide.  Without using the arete it's listed as 11a (the Variation) and with the arete 10a.  I originally did it without the arete not knowing it was already a TR, but since have been back and done it with the arete; it's probably a better problem with the arete, and only a touch easier.

name: Surrounded by the Lonely
description: Start on the left facing jug. Climb through great underclings and sidepulls to an airy topout. Stays on you the whole time.

name: Perscrutation
description: Start on sharp left hand undercling and small right hand crimp. Make a big move and then, using compression, continue up the face.

name: Inquisition
description: The left face of the same boulder as "Perscrutation." Start in the pit with two slopey compressions on the arete. Continue to use both aretes and some muscle to move up the face.

name: Dazed and Contused
description: Right arete and face. Crux is high (last move). I sat started, but had to dig out a rotten pile of leaves to do so and I don’t think a sit adds anything.

name: A Glimpse Beyond the Veil
description: Start on a jug at the far right side of the wall underneath the roof. Traverse left through a series of good holds eventually reaching a jug pinch at the lip. Set feet and head up the arete.

name: Haploid
description: Stand start with right hand meat hook and left hand on notched area of the arete. A few powerful moves on edges leads to a jug system that trends left to the top out.

name: Pivot Point
description: Start from a crouch with a sloper pinch for the right hand, left on a good sidepull in the face, and a right heel hook.  Move right gaining rail systems, a jug and an easing finish.

name: Flesh Rodeo
description: Sit start on slopey shelf on the right side of the boulder, climb up the overhanging face and then mantle for the finish. In my opinion a very good obvious pure boulder problem.

name: Bruised and Confused aka Dong of Dob
description: Sit start on left arete. Climb straight up.

name: Oogenesis
description: Start low with hands matched on left facing pinch rail. Powerful left hand move to gain the start hold of Young Eggs.

name: Pivotal Project
description: Start as for Pivot Point and climb the obvious squeeze feature.

name: Yankee Buzzard
description: From a sit climb the slabby arete.

name: Plumage
description: Start sitting with a jug.  Climb up and left through edges and slots and finish.

name: The Baker’s Fantasy
description: From the jug start of Fire Escape, move left, gain the arete and continue on.  Grade unconfirmed and not graded on the FA.

name: Big Bird
description: Start matched on a slopey edge.  Climb through sidepulls and punch a big move to a jug.  Top out.

name: Duck Tales
description: Pure and tricky..  Start matched from a stand in the obvious juggy undercling.  Climb the very clean arete.  A delicate and powerful problem.

name: Mockingjay
description: Start sitting with an obvious ledge system, probably hamhocking with the left hand.  After a tricky first sequence climb up and right out of the cave.  A lengthy Boulder problem for the lake.

name: Fire Escape
description: Start on the shelf in the mini corridor. After a couple not so bad moves to nice edges, bust a big move to a crimp right then head right through the roof feature and top out as for Spiral Staircase, gaining the arete and mantling into the scoop.  Fun and funky.

name: Spiral Staircase
description: From an obvious ledge system climb up and left out of the cave.  A left exit to Mockingjay (same start) and probably a little harder.

name: Atari Dream
description: Low start on good jugs and work up and around the left (west) arete.

name: Freebie
description: Start on large right hand side-pull feature and small left hand. Work through the bulge.

name: Emperor Penguin
description: From an obvious left facing sidepull climb the face through sidepulls and utilizing the arete higher.  A longer pull to the lip, mantle and boom, you’re standing on the lookout.  No detached blocks are used.

name: Bald Eagle
description: If you are standing at the lookout this probably tops out right where you are. Start sitting with sidepulls.  Move through a sidepull and a slopey ledge and finish up the airy arete.  And you are back on the lookout.

name: Carrion
description: Start from a crouch with a pockety hold for the right hand and an edge for the left.  Climb through the center of the pillar feature, gaining an undercling, a huge foothold, and pop for the lip.  A left version goes at V3, a right about V2.

name: Overgrown
description: Start with a right hand side-pull and left hand on the arete. A few powerful compression moves lead up the face. Detached blocks are not used.

name: Carcass
description: Start matched on good ledge, climbing up through a great pinch and edges.

name: The Verdant Wilds
description: Start matched in the horizontal crack underneath the roof. A few powerful moves lead to a tall slab.

name: Murder
description: Start matched on large undercling and climb up double arete feature to the lip.

name: Electric Sky
description: From a sit with good low holds climb through the lightning boltesque feature to an engaging mantle.  A spot and a few pads are nice.  Get on it!

name: Atari Nightmare
description: Start right hand on notch of the right arete, left on blocky pinch. Climb straight up the double aretes compressing to the lip. A fall at the top would be dangerous.

name: Ground Strike
description: Low start to Electric Sky. Start at the base of the small gulley on a jug. Climb a series of relatively easy, yet taxing moves into the start of Electric Sky and top out as for that boulder.

name: Social Distancing
description: Loooong, pretty fun and tricky.  On the Double Trouble boulder just on the other side.  Start in crack.  Traverse right through the crux.  Climb a fairly moderate slab to gain the second tier and finish up the arete (same one Double Trouble finishes on).

name: Double Trouble
description: Start matched on a slanting rail.  A few tricky moves up the arete gets you a good hold.  Move left, through seams and a long move to a better hold.  Gain the crack left, then keep going left utilizing a couple thin holds and a pinch.  Gain the arete and easily top out the spire.  Long and really fun I think.  Not so dangerous feeling, though with the double tiered landing it deserves some caution. The direct crack finish has also been done which definitely ups the danger level a bit, though is about the same difficulty.

name: The Ghost
description: From the large flake left of the arete, climb the striking and tall arete.

name: The Naturalist
description: Start sitting with obvious sidepulls.  Climb the tricky and technical arete.

name: Le Corbusier
description: Begin using a tricky right knee scum with left hand is low on a good sidepull and right hand is higher on a sloped sidepull both on the left arete. Compress into the starting position and cross left hand high on the arete to a sidepull with a thumb catch. Move along the lip right to the other side of the boulder. Stay tight for a technical top out up across the face.

name: Big Easy
description: Start on the big, obvious ledge and go directly up the face on great edges.

name: Big Time
description: Climb up the very tall face just left of Sex and Chocolate.  Don't use Detached boulders or the ledge out left.  A fall from high up could be bad.  Good climbing.

name: Drunk and Disorderly
description: Climb up the left arete of the tall pillar.  There is a committing move that leads to an airy topout above a less than perfect landing.

name: The Gargoyle
description: From a stand climb the right side of the arête encountering an airy crux.  The top does ease off.

name: Invisibility Cloak
description: Start from a stand, right hand up high on an okay shelf and left on an undercling. Pull on and launch up the intimidating and airy arête, probably moving slightly right on good holds and feet for the finish. The walls, detached blocks, trees or whatever aren't used, climb the arête!

name: Sex & Chocolate
description: Start right hand on a the crimp on the face, left hand on the good hold on the arete.  Move onto the arete and make a long move to the slopey jug.  Exit left or right from here, or continue to the top for the direct finish if you're into that sort of thing.  This is the style of problem where there is a fine line between it feeling impossible and impossibly easy...    With the completion of the direct finish, this is listed as a separate problem more for historical purposes than anything else...

name: Sex and Chocolate with a Cherry on Top (aka S&C Direct)
description: Climb Sex and Chocolate, traverse right at break and head straight up the head-wall using the arete and face holds.

name: Perfect Medium
description: Start using arete on right and small crimps on left.  Make your way to the obvious horizontal break at half-height using razor crimp, sloper, and abysmal feet.      Continue from the break up easier moves to the top of the boulder if you are feeling brave or just traverse off left or right to ledges.    Large foot hold at bottom might be considered "off" by some...just have fun

name: Thin Crack
description: Climb perfect finger crack just left of Soul Satori.  (The wide crack to the left is "Wide Open Burger".)

name: Soul Satori
description: Soul satori is located in the Thin Man Corridor, on the right arete as one is looking towards the lake. Although it may be over looked due to its easy grade, this climb may be the most aesthetic in the park when climbed at sunset. this is a must do for any climber, good exposure, beautiful view, and extremely fun climbing! Simply climb up the slabby arete, using good crimps on both sides, aiming for a nice ledge for the top out. A definate DL classic!

name: Fat Crack
description: 12 feet. A nice crack to exercise jamming skills, with plenty of face relief.  #74 on Zschiesche's bouldering guide.  Also know as "Thumbs of Steel" [107686548]

name: A Hunger Artist
description: From the toe of the arete, climb the right face and arete.    #72 on Zschiesche's bouldering guide.

name: Jack Spraight Delight
description: Ascend the west side of the corridor on nice finger-sized holds and sidepulls.    #75 on Zschiesche's bouldering guide.

name: Left side of East of Trail Boulders
description: Hmmm...did it in 2004. Warm up.

name: Slope of Dadaism
description: A super fun climb, my vote for best V3 in the park!  Climb up the left side of large face to slopers up high, top-out.

name: Pillar of Contemporary Movement
description: Starting on lower block, using arete and crimp up left, set feet high and dead-point to upper block.  Top out.

name: Axiom of Arete Aesthetics
description: Start at the base of pillar, and climb directly up arete to ledge, top-out.

name: Axiom Direct
description: Climb AAA, and instead of traversing of like everybody does, keep climbing to the apex of the pillar through a somewhat slopey bulge that would really suck to fall off.

name: Slope of Dynoism
description: Formally known as the dyno project, this thing is a monstrous dyno in the middle of the face to the right of Slope of Dadaism. Start with hands matched on the jug at head height in the middle of the face. From there work your way up into two  slot crimps. The dyno is from these crimps and goes to a bad rail about a foot below the lip!

name: Lost In The Wood
description: Start on obvious jugs and move up through cool compression moves to a classic DL topout.

name: Bearded Baby Jesus
description: Start on the left on a right hand flat crimp and left hand incut crimp above it.  Move right to a gaston, set up and throw for the lip.

name: Alexandria
description: Start low, below the face and climb straight up using the right arete and left side-pulls on the face.

name: No Man's Land
description: Begin low in the center of the face starting in a finger crack.  Follow the crack for a couple feet then find face holds as the rock face steepens.  Finish way up high with some committing moves to good holds.  Top out direct above where you started.

name: Tier Two
description: Sit start with right hand on good vertical edge and left on sloping nothing.  Make a move into the crack on the left to continue up the face with some squeeze compression.    If you punt off the top you could miss the first tier pad.

name: Short String
description: Fun little crack, would be great if it was longer.

name: Not Gonna Eat Bark
description: Climb tall arete on block just right of Bark Biter.

name: Big Bud Arete
description: Starting on right corner climb up to break and head straight up face using both aretes.  Super tall and scary, but the landing isn't bad.

name: Big Dud Arete
description: Down the hill and off to the side of Big Bud lies another tall and scary highball. Although similar in aesthetic and height to the mega-classic, in comparison the climbing is sadly inferior.  Big Dud is a much easier climb and the landing is much worse. Follow the juggy shelves up the prominent arete and dont fall.   This line has probably been soloed by many in the past.   If being up high excites you but pulling hard doesn't, this is the route for you!

name: The Giese Dome
description: Start just left of corner, crank up to a good ledge and slopey topout.  Really fun V2, a must do.

name: Show Me The Kind
description: Figure out a way to balance your way up the slab in order to get to the left facing crimp in the crack.  Make a dynamic move to a big hold and then top out.

name: Evergreen
description: Climb clean, steep face with big moves on small holds, finishing up and right.  Fun and commiting!

name: The Urumi
description: Start standing in the hole, on the ledge at the base of the striking arete. Right hand on a decent spot on the arete, left on a crimp sidepull.  A few compression moves, mostly standing on your feet, leads to a long move to a juggy hold in a seam.  Follow good holds in the seam left and top out the pointy spire.  A spectacular and fun climb in an intimidating position.

name: Imp Act
description: I'm pretty sure I've climbed this but I can't remember the grade. Any care to fill in the blanks?

name: Gay Gigolo
description: Start on underclings/sidepulls and make your way up good holds to a fun throw for the top.    You can also do this climb from a sitstart.

name: Elegant Design
description: Start right hand edge and left hand juggy undercling. Climb up face to pocket and topout.

name: Shadow Walker
description: Start as for pocket problem and traverse through tricky moves into the start of the v1 face. This one would clean up well with traffic.

name: Greatest Show on Earth
description: Start on underclings and climb straight up the center of the largest boulder.  I think the problem was originally topped out by climbing straight up, however recent repeats have found that escaping left is both easier and somewhat less scary.  Do what gets you psyched.

name: Circus World
description: Start seated on two rounded edges.  Climb five moves into the start of Greatest Show.

name: Talus Scramble
description: Off the trail to monolith there are some talus fields you can climb around in. There are some boulder problems, as well as technical 4th class scrambling. This is one of the harder scrambles.

name: Bonamici Arete (aka Tequila)
description: Start low on large ledge and get out to right arete.  Follow the arete to the top.  Super fun, and the grade varies depending on who you ask.

name: The Substitute
description: Same start as Mean Gurlz then follows the right arete to an airy top out!

name: Mean Gurlz Direct (aka The Clique)
description: Start seated low on the right arete as for Mean Gurlz. The first several moves of that problem lead to a long lock off to the lip.  Top out directly over the slab.

name: Mean Gurlz
description: Start from a sit on the right arete, with your right hand on a biter sidepull crimp, and your left on a slanted slopey edge.  Move to the rail system, then trend leftwards through the rails, encountering interesting moves.  Once the left arete is gained top it out.  The moves get easier at the finish, but blowing the mantle could be a very bad, be careful!

name: Water Chestnut
description: Start in lower left side of cave, right hand on a sloper and left hand in a crack. Left hand to a pinch, hit the sloper and bump to the sloper sidepull. Go straight up.

name: The Joy of Life
description: Climbs Born in Blood through Tip Top. 20+ moves of hard climbing.

name: Born in Blood
description: This is a low start to Tipping Point.  Start with your right hand on a sidepull, and your left on the arete.  Pull on and climb into Tipping Point.  Core intensive and a lot of moves.

name: Dr. Strange
description: A funky and unique one.  Start crouched with a left sloper on the arete and right low undercling at the base of the block.  A scrunchy bicycle may prove useful.  Gain the lip, work up the arete and mantle as for Big Wobbly.  The detached blocks aren’t used.

name: Espionage
description: From a sit with your arms wide, left hand on a low downpulling edge, right on a low and thin sidepull, pull on and go up the face.  Tough first move and fun delicate climbing on perfect rock.  A 5 move problem or so.

name: Diamond in the Rough
description: Start on good edges and bump out left to good hold.  Hike feet and stand up into under-cling.  Top out is interesting.

name: The Wave Rider
description: To get started grab large block in middle of boulder, get a good left heel-toe cam, left hand pinch, and right hand on good rail.  Bump out left to good crimp and fight your way up using smart footwork to gain high side-pull.  Committing throw to the finish.  So rad!!

name: Wave Rider Direct
description: Start as for Wave Rider, but instead of veering left to finish, stay true to the arete and face.  This is a great problem and it deserves some action.  It has an airy feeling but is safe if padded.  One of the best of the grade in the park?  Quite possibly.

name: Dagger of the Lake
description: Start low facing toward the lake(Ian swears it's easier) and pull up and out boulder on bad slopers and powerfull foot trickery.

name: Sunny & 60's
description: Start with good block on lower right, paste foot and throw for incut edge.  Cross through and gain good slopey bread loaf.  Turn the corner and get out to face.  Top out is a bit heady.

name: Good Morning Veruca
description: Stand start with right hand crimp and reach left out to slopey jug.  Hike your feet and move up intimidating arete.  Super exposed, but really fun!

name: Galactic
description: Start sitting matched on the bottom of the arête.  Follow the arête right, using the huge foot to finish.

name: Space Jam
description: From a high stand, surmount the bulgey head wall.  I started left hand jugglet and right on a pinch on the lip.  Only a few mover so maybe it's not so hard right? A pure and tricky problem.

name: Everclear
description: Start on the jug at chest height in the middle of the wall as per Evergreen, but at mid height move to the left side of the face and top out.  Tall with an exciting last move.

name: The Wind Rider
description: Start down low on good edges.  Power your way up steep arete to a crux finish.  Really fun movement, and thanks to Mike Lohre for cleaning this one up!

name: Battle Cry
description: Start with good left hand low and right out on lip.  Kick feet high and climb feature out and right.  Lots of power and focus gets you up this one.

name: Uncertainty Principle
description: From a sit in the crack, climb up and right across the tall face above the bouldery landing.  There is a long crux move in the middle that will surely feel harder or easier depending on your height.

name: The Commander
description: From a stand, climb the stiriking, intimidating and long arête.  The landing is double tiered and it works out that you can pull onto almost any move and work it out..

name: Science Friction
description: Start with decent side-pulls low and right, gain the textured edge and sack-up and send!  Originally probably soft 9 but a foot broke making it bigger and the last move got a bit easier.

name: Uncut Gems
description: Start from a stand, right hand in the arete and left probably on an inverted pinch below the lip.  Climb up the arete, mantle and finish with easing but airy climbing.  A fall off to the right could be really bad so pad and spot, and of course climb accordingly.

name: Blood Diamond
description: Start standing high, with a good left hand pinch, and an inverted undercling pinch for the right just on the edge of the roof.  Pull on, perhaps get a toe hook and shuffle up some holds.  Better holds are gained and an airy but not so hard finish awaits.

name: Danger Mouse
description: Start on the obvious two edges back in the cave. Place a solid toe jam and work the moves along the sloping edges and pinch out of the tight cave maintaining tension and body positions to prevent dabbing. Following the toe jam release crux, set up into the start holds of Gnarls Barkley and finish it off.

name: Rubick's Groove
description: Fun cube-like boulder. SDS with left hand on crimp and right hand around corner on small block. Work up the arete and then throw for the top! Mantle

name: High Radiance
description: Start from a slanting edge and a crimp just below for the right.  Bust a big move right (crux). Continue along the lip and mantle.

name: Low Radiance
description: Start right hand on crimp-pinch at the lip and left on a crimp just below the lip. Right heel and scummy toe hook beneath the roof. Pull into the heel then throw for the left hand start holds of High Radiance. Match and carefully set up for start then climb out High Radiance.

name: Sowing Life
description: Start with the large jug on the face. Climb the tall arete and detached block using awesome holds.

name: Mutual Attraction
description: Small, yes.  Potentially a new age classic?  For sure.  Start on the prominent flat ledge on the left side, probably pull up and far right to a pinch and finish it up.  A pure and high quality little problem.  Also easily accessible and not so hard to find.

name: Slap It
description: Two hand start left on boulder (on a hold with grooves). Dynamic move up right, up to a jug and top out.

name: Leopard Cobra
description: A great blocky feature on the backside of a tower right in the projects. Start squeezing the face and then find a combination of crimps and compression moves to reach a jug. This route climbs in classic DL style.. a technical and unforgiving sequence leads to easier but more consequential climbing to the top  Thanks to some new beta from Cody Wheeler, the beginning moves go much easier and keep this thing consistently V1 all the way.

name: Cobra
description: This line is the right variation of Leopard Cobra; a solid climb reminiscent of Special K and the Welcome Crack on the north shore. The technical feet up high and the wall looming close behind make this thing pretty spicy. All the holds are there and the top out is satisfying, so git on it!

name: River Boulder  1
description: Historically this boulder has many variations (problems) on it. They were never named or graded. Climbs ranged from V0-V6. This is one of the  more obvious lines we saw on this boulder.    There are 2 variations to start this problem out.    1. V3 Start on the far left end of the boulder in the pit. Heel hook and use left hand jug and right hand on sloper. Make a big move and work your way up.    2. V2 Start using large undercling rail on the right side of the overhang. Make a large move for the same hold as the start 1.

name: Leopard
description: A variation of Leopard Cobra, this line stays on the left arete to the top. With the left hand starting under the low roof and right on a half moon side pull, use tension to reach a rail and a crimp. Find high feet, move up to the jug and top out.  Not using the detached feet makes the first move more balancey and fun

name: River Boulder  2
description: Historically this boulder has many variations (problems) on it. They were never named or graded. Climbs range from V0-V6. This is one of the  more obvious lines we saw on this boulder.    This problem is on the riverside of the boulder. Start in the middle of the boulder on good holds. Heel hook and make move to good undercling. Make a huge move out right to gain jug, make a few move big moves to finish it up on the arete

name: Cast Iron
description: Climb slightly overhanging face on slopers and thin holds.  FA was April 2016.  No repeats yet.    Going into the corner has been done subsequently and is V7ish, "Softer than Iron".

name: Twoarete Syndrome
description: The best Sandstone in Wisconsin!  Stand Start with right hand on pebble and left hand on bad sloper.  Use horrible feet and slap up the slopey aretes to gain a good hold at top.  Very unique for the area.

name: Rebel Pride
description: You won't find better sandstone anywhere.  Bullet hard and extremely difficult, this is a fantastic project.  Sit start with obvious holds under right arete roof.  Use small holds and slopers to make it to the good holds on lip.  You can see all the moves on this problem, they are just really hard!  Get on it.

name: Aqua Dagger
description: Start on good holds on the block directly beneath the cube. Move up right on the arete using a series of obvious crimps, and throw for the lip. Crux is probably the tensiony move getting the left hand from a face undercling onto the horizontal crack in the arete.

name: Bengal Tiger
description: Starts in the pit on a left hand sloper and a right hand sidepull. A few moves up the arete leads to a left hand jug. Top out to the left.

name: The Thaw
description: Start with good right hand undercling and left hand edge. Climb up arete.

name: Extinction
description: Awesome dyno! Start with both hands on good holds in the horizontal. Get high feet and gun to good hold up top. Detached block under the roof was not used for feet.

name: Snow Leopard
description: Start matched on large vertical side pull under the roof. Climb out roof using a pinch and an amazing sloper to get to better holds.

name: 24 Carat
description: From the slot jug left of the arete (same start as Medallion) climb the tall slab.  The crux is pulling the mini roof but you do have to keep it together for the finish.  The top top is quite easy.

name: Long Winter
description: Start matched on ledge climb directly up face to better holds.

name: Medallion
description: This thing is a stunner.  Starting with an obvious slot jug, climb the big and beautiful arete.  The climbing eases the higher you get.  I did it with four pads, though the more the merrier.

name: Frigid
description: Start matched on large side pull and climb up edges.

name: Frostbite
description: Start sitting left hand sloping pinch right hand side pull and crack some moves up the prow.
